intro: Narcissus glaucifolius, commonly known as the glaucous-leaved daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. Native to southern Europe, particularly the Iberian Peninsula, this plant thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. It is typically found in rocky or limestone areas, often growing in open woodlands or scrubland. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its early spring blooms.
